result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prior: 442 Camino Sobrante Road, Orinda, CA 94563
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - DENIED - Eligible for SPD representation.

10:30 AM Defendant Michael William Mitchell appeared by video from Marinette County Jail.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Mitchell states he has contacted SPD, filled out the application, SPD informed him that they would appoint him an attorney and that he is eligible, states SPD asked Court to set matter out. State - bond - continue bond. Mitchell did write to the Court for a bond hearing. Court has received those letters. Court - bond - continues bond for stated reasons, may need a co-signer. Court sets for AIA on 10/12/22 at 10:30 AM, keep in constant contact with SPD.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
from defendant indicating addresses he can reside at and his employer.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:48 AM Defendant Michael William Mitchell appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has contacted SPD and they indicated he did not qualify. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney; private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Court will have court appointed paperwork sent over to the jail. State - asks for bond to be increased to $2000 cash. Mitchell makes statement, has friend in Crivitz. Court authorizes increase in bond and sets to $2000 cash bond and sets for AIA. Mitchell asks how he can get a signature bond. Court responds and can be addressed once an attorney is appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
